bestBHT.bht: John the Baptist fulfilled the promise in Malachi, as Jesus identifies him with the prophesied Elijah, even though John denied being the actual Elijah. The people did not recognize John, just as they do not know Jesus. Like unbelief followed persecution, they acted according to their own desires, not knowing John's true identity. The prophecy of Malachi was fulfilled in John as the forerunner of the Messiah, but the people failed to recognize him and the coming of the Messiah.

Philip Schaff: The prophecy of Malachi had been fulfilled in John the Baptist, so far as the first coming of the Messiah was concerned.
They recognized, neither John the forerunner of the Messiah, nor the Messiah himself.
Archibald T. Robertson: Thus Jesus identifies John the Baptist with the promise in Malachi, though not the real Elijah in person which John denied (John 1:21)."
They knew him not (ουκ επιγνωσαν αυτον). Second aorist active indicative of επιγινωσκω, to recognize.
Just as they do not know Jesus now (John 1:26). They killed John as they will Jesus the Son of Man.
John Gill: but have done unto him whatsoever they listed
they did not know him to be the Elias
likewise also shall the son of man suffer of them
John Wesley: Elijah is come already — And yet when the Jews asked John, Art thou Elijah? He said, I am not, John 1:21.
His meaning was, I am not Elijah the Tishbite, come again into the world.
But he was the person of whom Malachi prophesied under that name.

bhtAttempts.bht: John the Baptist fulfilled the promise in Malachi as the forerunner of the Messiah, even though he denied being the literal Elijah. Just as the people did not recognize John, they also do not know Jesus, whom they will later kill. The prophecy of Malachi was fulfilled in John, yet the people failed to recognize him as well as the Messiah. Like unbelief followed persecution, the people acted according to their own desires, not knowing John's true identity as the prophesied Elijah.

The prophecy of Malachi was fulfilled in John, yet the people failed to recognize him as well as the Messiah. Like unbelief followed persecution, the people acted according to their own desires, not knowing John's true identity as the prophesied Elijah.

John the Baptist fulfilled the promise in Malachi, as Jesus identifies him with the prophesied Elijah, even though John denied being the actual Elijah. The people did not recognize John, just as they do not know Jesus. Like unbelief followed persecution, they acted according to their own desires, not knowing John's true identity. The prophecy of Malachi was fulfilled in John as the forerunner of the Messiah, but the people failed to recognize him and the coming of the Messiah.

John the Baptist fulfilled the promise in Malachi as Jesus identifies him with the prophesied Elijah, even though John denied personally being Elijah. The people failed to recognize John and the coming of the Messiah. Like unbelief followed persecution, the people acted according to their own desires, not understanding John's true identity. The prophecy of Malachi was fulfilled in John as the forerunner of the Messiah, but the people did not recognize him and the Messiah himself.
